predictions.text: U.S. CPI (headline, MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between -0.1% and +0.2% in the BLS release due mid-November.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the MoM percent change for CPI-U All Items, seasonally adjusted, in the October 2025 CPI news release on bls.gov is within [-0.1%, +0.2%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Daily AAA national average gasoline prices and weekly EIA gasoline data
Wholesale used-car prices (Manheim Index) and new/used vehicle CPI components
Shelter leading indicators (Zillow/OER proxies), and utilities prices
WTI/Brent crude trends and refining margins
High-frequency food price trackers
predictions.rationale: Falling fuel prices and softer goods inflation offset sticky shelter, keeping headline CPI subdued.

predictions.text: U.S. Unemployment Rate (U-3) for October 2025 will print between 4.2% and 4.4% in the Employment Situation report due 2025-11-08.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the seasonally adjusted U-3 unemployment rate in the October 2025 Employment Situation news release on bls.gov is within [4.2%, 4.4%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Initial and continuing jobless claims trend
Household survey participation rate and employment-population ratio signals
Regional Fed and ISM employment sub-indexes
Corporate layoff announcements (Challenger) and hiring freezes
predictions.rationale: Layoff announcements and softer labor demand point to a modest uptick in unemployment without a sharp deterioration.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. Initial Jobless Claims will print at or above 245,000 in at least one weekly Department of Labor release by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check weekly ETA Unemployment Insurance news releases; any SA initial claims figure ≥245,000 through the 2025-11-30 reference week satisfies.
monitoring_signals: High-frequency layoff announcements and WARN notices
Continuing claims trajectory vs seasonal norms
Small business labor demand (NFIB) and online job postings
Macro shocks from shutdown-related disruptions
predictions.rationale: Elevated layoffs and rising slack raise the odds of at least one higher weekly claims print.

predictions.text: From 2025-11-06 close to 2025-11-30 close, Tesla (TSLA) will underperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) by at least 5.0 percentage points on an adjusted-close basis.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Yahoo Finance adjusted closes for TSLA and SPY, compute percentage change from 2025-11-06 to 2025-11-30. If TSLA change − SPY change ≤ −5.0 pp, this is true.
monitoring_signals: Legal challenges and governance headlines on Tesla’s pay plan
EV demand/margin updates and production adjustments at Ford/others
AI-linked equity risk sentiment and rates volatility
Options market skew/IV for TSLA vs SPY
predictions.rationale: Governance overhang and EV demand headwinds may weigh on TSLA relative to broad beta.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-15, on at least one day, FlightAware will report ≥20% of flights delayed at EWR, LGA, or JFK.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via FlightAware’s MiseryMap or airport pages that for any one UTC day through 2025-11-15, the reported percent of delayed flights at EWR, LGA, or JFK is ≥20%. Screenshots or archived reports acceptable.
monitoring_signals: FAA traffic management initiatives and NOTAMs
Northeast U.S. weather forecasts (low ceilings, wind, precip)
Airline crew availability and ATC staffing updates
Real-time FlightAware delay percentages for NYC airports
predictions.rationale: FAA cuts plus fall weather elevate delay risk at congested NYC hubs.

predictions.text: The Federal Reserve will announce at least one additional formal enforcement action (e.g., consent order, written agreement) by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check federalreserve.gov enforcement press releases/updates; any new formal action posted and dated after 2025-11-06 through 2025-11-30 qualifies.
monitoring_signals: Fed enforcement RSS/feed updates
Emerging bank risk metrics (CRE exposure, liquidity)
Parallel actions by OCC and FDIC indicating sector pressure
Earnings 8-Ks referencing supervisory matters
predictions.rationale: Ongoing supervisory pressure on smaller lenders suggests more actions are likely.

predictions.text: U.S. 5-Year, 5-Year Forward Inflation Expectation Rate (FRED: T5YIFR) will close at or below 2.20% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify on FRED that the daily T5YIFR value is ≤2.20% for any trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Headline and core inflation prints (CPI/PCE) vs expectations
Treasury real yields (TIPS) and breakeven curves
Growth data (retail sales, ISM) and labor slack indicators
Fed-speak on inflation progress and policy path
predictions.rationale: Softer growth and cooling inflation can compress long-term inflation expectations.

predictions.text: NY Harbor RBOB Gasoline front-month futures (CME: RB) will settle at or below $2.10 per gallon on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the official CME settlement for the RB front-month contract is ≤$2.10/gal on any session through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Crude benchmarks (WTI/Brent) and product cracks
Refinery utilization and maintenance outages
Seasonal gasoline demand (EIA product supplied)
Inventories of gasoline and blending components
predictions.rationale: Seasonal demand slowdown and adequate supply pressure gasoline futures lower.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage will show at least one net withdrawal of ≥5 Bcf in a report published by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: In EIA’s Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report, any week’s ‘Net change’ ≤ -5 Bcf (i.e., withdrawal ≥5 Bcf) through 2025-11-30 satisfies.
monitoring_signals: Heating degree day (HDD) forecasts and actuals
LNG feedgas levels and pipeline flows
Appalachia and Permian production trends
Regional storage levels vs 5-year averages
predictions.rationale: Withdrawal season onset and colder snaps typically yield an early small withdrawal.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, the U.S. Treasury’s OFAC will announce at least one new Venezuela-related sanctions designation.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check home.treasury.gov press releases; any new designation under the Venezuela sanctions program dated through 2025-11-30 qualifies.
monitoring_signals: U.S.–Venezuela diplomatic developments and congressional actions
Regional security incidents and migration pressures
Oil sector policy shifts and licensing changes
State Department and NSC statements
predictions.rationale: Rising regional tensions and policy volatility increase the likelihood of fresh designations.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, Meta will announce enhanced advertiser verification or disclosure rules targeting scam/fraud ads (e.g., stricter ID checks or certifications) via an official Meta newsroom or policy update.
predictions.verification_criteria: An official Meta newsroom post, policy page, or press release announcing new or tightened verification/disclosure requirements specifically aimed at reducing scam/fraud ads by 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Regulatory inquiries/complaints from FTC/EU authorities
Public commitments by Meta on brand safety and integrity
Policy updates for financial/crypto/political ads
Industry pressure and advertiser boycotts
predictions.rationale: Heightened scrutiny and reputational risk create pressure for swift ad integrity policy changes.

predictions.text: Cboe Nasdaq-100 Volatility Index (VXN) will close at or above 28.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm on cboe.com that the official daily closing value of VXN is ≥28.00 for any trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: QQQ drawdowns and breadth deterioration in mega-cap tech
Options skew and term structure steepening in Nasdaq names
Macro event risk (shutdown, CPI/PPI, retail sales)
Earnings/newsflow from AI bellwethers
predictions.rationale: Heightened AI/mega-cap volatility and macro catalysts could push tech vol to episodic spikes.
